column2: ALASKA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a cross road.

column2: 2. A solid red arrow means:
column6: Stop, then proceed when it is safe to do so
column8: Stop and do not turn until the arrow turns green

column2: 3. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: stop and wait for the light to change.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column10: proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 4. A green arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: means the same as a circular green light, but you must go only in the direction indicated by the arrow.
column6: is used only on one-way streets.
column8: provide directional and mileage information to specific destinations.
column10: means that you may go only if the green arrow is accompanied by a green light.

column2: 5. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column8: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 6. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.
column8: an intersection ahead.

column2: 7. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 8. When driving in fog:
column8: turn on your low beams.

column2: 9. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column8: Better reflexes

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column8: You must make a complete stop

column2: 11. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: The traffic signal is broken.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 12. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column8: no passing zone

column2: 13. You are driving on a four-lane divided highway, two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of you, and you are in a hurry. You should:
column4: drive closely behind the vehicles ahead changing lanes frequently.
column6: drive in either lane with at least a two-second time interval behind the vehicle ahead.
column8: drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
column10: drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.

column2: 14. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 15. Parking lights may only be used:
column8: when your vehicle is parked.

column2: 16. If you are following a truck, you should:
column4: All the other answers are correct.
column6: position your car so the truck driver can see you in his side mirrors.
column8: always dim your headlights at night.
column10: stay out of its blind spot to the rear.

column2: 17. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column8: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 18. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column8: turning your head and glancingÂ over your shoulder.
column10: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.

column2: 19. A pedestrian is crossing the street in a crosswalk. You must:
column4: sound your horn and proceed with caution.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian cross.
column8: drive off as soon as the pedestrian has moved past your car.
column10: slow down and go around the person at a slow pace.

column2: 20. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column6: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.
column8: Always.
